title.narrative: Emergency project to provide life-saving shelter assistance to IDPs and Host communities in Jowhar, Middle Shabelle through pre-positioning and distribution of basic Non-Food Items and Construction of Emergency Shelters.

description.narrative:
In the context of projected rainfalls and increased risk of flooding in Middle Shabelle, AVORD is submitting this emergency proposal with the aim of pre-positioning/distribution of basic Non-Food Items (NFIs) and construction of emergency shelters for 5,500 most vulnerable IDP and host community households (33,000 IDP persons) in Jowhar district. The target group largely reside in makeshift buuls without adequate access to basic necessities including shelter.
Following need-based and transparent selection of beneficiaries, AVORD will provide effected households with NFI kits comprising of 1 Plastic Sheet, 2 Blankets, 2 Sleeping Mats, 1 Kitchen Set, 1 Mosquito Net, 1 Solar Torch and 1 Jerrycan with the capacity of 10 liters each. The proposed content in each set is based on current Shelter Cluster standards for people in emergencies. In addition to NFIs, emergency shelters will be constructed for newly displaced households living in deplorable shelter conditions. Proper site planning will be undertaken during the construction of shelters to ensure effective mitigation of hazards and reduce congestion levels. AVORD will also employ an owner-driven approach by capacitating the IDPs to undertake the construction process. If market conditions allow, AVORD will use a cash-based modality for implementation.
Protection will be mainstreamed throughout project duration by closely coordinating with other partners operating Sexual and Gender Based Violence (SGBV) crisis centers and facilitating principled referrals where necessary. The effectiveness of the aid package will be evaluated through third party Post Distribution Monitoring exercises thus ensuring that beneficiaries access their services safely and in a dignified manner. An elaborate feedback and complain mechanism will be setup to ensure accountability to the effected population.
In the delivery of the proposed package, AVORD will seek Integration with other clusters and own interventions in the region to ensure complementarity, value for money and efficiency of the response.
